snippet: At least 50 people, including children, were killed by gunmen and suicide bombers in a series of raids on villages outside the city of Maiduguri, officials said.
abstract: Nigerian officials blame Boko Haram for deadly assaults on settlements near Maiduguri in in Borno Province; estimate at least 50 died in series of armed attacks and suicide bombings.

byline.original: By SUNDAY ISUWA and DIONNE SEARCEY
byline.contributor: Sunday Isuwa reported from Kaduna, Nigeria, and Dionne Searcey from Dakar, Senegal.

lead_paragraph: At least 50 people, including children, were killed by gunmen and suicide bombers in a series of raids on villages outside the city of Maiduguri, officials said.

headline.main: Boko Haram Burns Villages in Northeastern Nigeria
headline.print_headline: Dozens Are Killed in Raids in Nigeria
